title: [IOTDB-5033] Fix deadlock in memory pool
body:
There exists dead lock case in current MemoryPool implementation.

```java
Found one Java-level deadlock:
=============================
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-50$20221123_152410_87128_5.0.0.0":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007ff16c00ec78 (object 0x00000005cbe177d8, a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool),
  which is held by "pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-43$20221123_152410_87142_5.0.0.0"
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-43$20221123_152410_87142_5.0.0.0":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007ff16c010278 (object 0x00000005dc0ba760, a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue),
  which is held by "pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-22$20221123_152410_87114_5.0.0.0"
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-22$20221123_152410_87114_5.0.0.0":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007ff16c00ec78 (object 0x00000005cbe177d8, a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool),
  which is held by "pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-43$20221123_152410_87142_5.0.0.0"

Java stack information for the threads listed above:
===================================================
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-50$20221123_152410_87128_5.0.0.0":
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool.free(MemoryPool.java:184)
	- waiting to lock <0x00000005cbe177d8> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue.remove(SharedTsBlockQueue.java:129)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.receive(LocalSourceHandle.java:99)
	- locked <0x00000005d2b97308> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.getSerializedTsBlock(LocalSourceHandle.java:115)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getSerializedTsBlock(QueryExecution.java:452)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution$$Lambda$1005/498612315.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getResult(QueryExecution.java:404)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getByteBufferBatchResult(QueryExecution.java:448)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.utils.QueryDataSetUtils.convertQueryResultByFetchSize(QueryDataSetUtils.java:387)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.impl.ClientRPCServiceImpl.fetchResultsV2(ClientRPCServiceImpl.java:423)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3528)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3508)
	at org.apache.thrift.ProcessFunction.process(ProcessFunction.java:38)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.ProcessorWithMetrics.process(ProcessorWithMetrics.java:64)
	at org.apache.thrift.server.TThreadPoolServer$WorkerProcess.run(TThreadPoolServer.java:248)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-43$20221123_152410_87142_5.0.0.0":
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue.lambda$add$0(SharedTsBlockQueue.java:161)
	- waiting to lock <0x00000005dc0ba760> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue$$Lambda$1068/1953903521.run(Unknown Source)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.DirectExecutor.execute(DirectExecutor.java:31)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.executeListener(AbstractFuture.java:1270)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.complete(AbstractFuture.java:1038)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.set(AbstractFuture.java:783)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool$MemoryReservationFuture.set(MemoryPool.java:64)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool.free(MemoryPool.java:216)
	- locked <0x00000005cbe177d8> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue.remove(SharedTsBlockQueue.java:129)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.receive(LocalSourceHandle.java:99)
	- locked <0x00000005d2c187f8> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.getSerializedTsBlock(LocalSourceHandle.java:115)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getSerializedTsBlock(QueryExecution.java:452)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution$$Lambda$1005/498612315.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getResult(QueryExecution.java:404)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getByteBufferBatchResult(QueryExecution.java:448)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.utils.QueryDataSetUtils.convertQueryResultByFetchSize(QueryDataSetUtils.java:387)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.impl.ClientRPCServiceImpl.fetchResultsV2(ClientRPCServiceImpl.java:423)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3528)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3508)
	at org.apache.thrift.ProcessFunction.process(ProcessFunction.java:38)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.ProcessorWithMetrics.process(ProcessorWithMetrics.java:64)
	at org.apache.thrift.server.TThreadPoolServer$WorkerProcess.run(TThreadPoolServer.java:248)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
"pool-25-IoTDB-ClientRPC-Processor-22$20221123_152410_87114_5.0.0.0":
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool.free(MemoryPool.java:184)
	- waiting to lock <0x00000005cbe177d8> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.memory.MemoryPool)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue.remove(SharedTsBlockQueue.java:129)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.receive(LocalSourceHandle.java:99)
	- locked <0x00000005dc0ba760> (a org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.SharedTsBlockQueue)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.execution.exchange.LocalSourceHandle.getSerializedTsBlock(LocalSourceHandle.java:115)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getSerializedTsBlock(QueryExecution.java:452)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution$$Lambda$1005/498612315.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getResult(QueryExecution.java:404)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.mpp.plan.execution.QueryExecution.getByteBufferBatchResult(QueryExecution.java:448)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.utils.QueryDataSetUtils.convertQueryResultByFetchSize(QueryDataSetUtils.java:387)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.impl.ClientRPCServiceImpl.fetchResultsV2(ClientRPCServiceImpl.java:423)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3528)
	at org.apache.iotdb.service.rpc.thrift.IClientRPCService$Processor$fetchResultsV2.getResult(IClientRPCService.java:3508)
	at org.apache.thrift.ProcessFunction.process(ProcessFunction.java:38)
	at org.apache.iotdb.db.service.thrift.ProcessorWithMetrics.process(ProcessorWithMetrics.java:64)
	at org.apache.thrift.server.TThreadPoolServer$WorkerProcess.run(TThreadPoolServer.java:248)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

Found 1 deadlock.


```

why we need to put this outside MemoryPool's lock?
If we put this block inside the MemoryPool's lock, we will get deadlock case like the ollowing:
Assuming that

thread-A: LocalSourceHandle.receive() -> A-SharedTsBlockQueue.remove() -> MemoryPool.free() (hold MemoryPool's lock) -> future.set(null) -> try to get  B-SharedTsBlockQueue's lock

thread-B: LocalSourceHandle.receive() -> B-SharedTsBlockQueue.remove() (hold B-SharedTsBlockQueue's lock) -> try to get MemoryPool's lock

title: optimize the distribution plan for aggregation with align by device
body: ## Description Before this PR, lots of FI will be generated even though they are only be distributed to several DataRegions. It is because some FI will be distributed to same DataRegion. It is limited by current implementation of Aggregation PlanNode/Operator. In this PR, I made a separate distribution planning method for `Aggregation align by device`. That is, most of the device will only have one DataRegion related in one query, so we can group the node with the same DataRegion with one DeviceViewNode. And then add a DeviceMergeViewNode on all DeviceViewNodes. See the snapshot below: (each color represents one different DataRegion)

No the generated go files have their packages.
However as the stupid plugin we used to generate thrift codes, we can't specify the parameter to generate with  full import path, which results the package `rpc` imports `common` but can't be used in iotdb-client-go directly, we should just change the import path manually as a workaround.

title: [IOTDB-5023] Improve Schema Count operation to return long
body:
## Description


### Motivation

Since we want to use iotdb cluster to manage 10 billion timeseries, which far exceeds the MAX_VALUE of int, we cannot use int as the format of schema statistic result.

### Modification

1. Make the schema count operation return long, including:
    1. count timeseries
    2. count timeseries group by level
    3. count device
    4. count nodes 
2. Make the internal schema statistics method return long, including:
    1. timeseries statistic used in delete timeseries
    2. device statistic used in deactivate timeseries
    3. device statistic used in unset timeseries

title: [IOTDB-5021] Using Junit parameterized test to optimize schema IT framework
body: ## Description In order to make the integrate tests cover Schema_File mode and Memory mode, we originally needed to create two classes for each IT, such as IoTDBMetadataFetchIT and IoTDBMetadataFetchSchemaFileIT, which would result in a large number of classes. This ISSUE introduces a JUnit parametric test approach. An `AbstractSchemaIT` abstract class is created for all schema test, and its subclasses will automatically run tests in both schema engine modes. > reference: > https://blog.csdn.net/w605283073/article/details/80051229 > https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27745691/how-to-combine-runwith-with-runwithparameterized-class

title: Better schema file printer, not limited by length anymore
body:
## Description
Previously SchemaFile provide a sketch method by building all text content into one single String, which may take unnecessary memory overhead. Now SchemaFile will flush sketched text into a PrintWriter in a page by page way so that even huge SchemaFile could be handled with a limited memory resource.

title: [IOTDB-4572] [IOTDB-3580] support order by in align by device
body:
This PR add the support of order time and order by device in align by device.
It designs a general PlanOperator called mergeSortOperatpr to support order by time and replace the orginal deviceMergeOperator in order by device.

Design document: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/NNQVdbYTtoOY31x7FvAcDT61nPb
Test document: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/PsbqduXBYod16kxENhAcvevMn9d
UserGuide document: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/PBjMdhKORouRU5xJpCLcRIeYnbe

In response time test in standalone machine with 13 device * 100 sensors * 100000 data, MergeSortOperator shows similar performance comparing with DeviceMergeOperator.

title: [IOTDB-5008] Fix SHUTDOWN errors in ratis create peer
body:
When adding a new member to an existed group, the correct order is:
1. call createPeer on new member with **EMPTY GROUP**.
2. call addPeer on original group with full group.

This PR enables RatisConsensus to handle EMPTY GROUP create peer requests.

title: Fix the bug that the AggregationNode is always Final
body:
## Description
Before this change, if the logical plan contains only 1 series and the series belongs to serval DataRegions, the distribution plan will always set the AggragtionStep to `FINAL`, which is not correct. This PR fixed this issue and add two more unit tests for this scenarios.

title: [IOTDB-4830] Fixed some bugs when removing an unknown node
body:
## IOTDB-4830
1. Disabled some error message because they may be annoying for users.
2. Fixed the bug that removing an unknown node causes error when the remaining running data node after removing equals replica number.
3. Reduce the retry-num to 1 when trying to connect the removed data node while it's unknown.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/202992603-483fb32b-ab53-4288-b8c8-d8a5a654d309.png)
Error message disabled
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/202985829-e7f4239f-c375-4ac5-b80c-ecf91c13f08c.png)
(Node 6 is previously unknown)

title: Fix a document typo about status code 503
body:
## Fix a description typo of status code 503
The appropriate description for status code 503 (`TIMESERIES_ALREADY_EXIST`) is `Timeseries already exists`, while the original error description is `Timeseries number exceeds the threshold`.

For Chinese docs: `docs\zh\UserGuide\API\Status-Codes.md`
For English docs: `docs\UserGuide\API\Status-Codes.md`

title: [IOTDB-4983] Greedy leader balancing policy
body:
Although we currently have MinCostFlowLeaderBalancer to deal with the cluster leader balancing problem. We still need a simple GreedyLeaderBalancer to compare with the MinCostFlowLeaderBalancer. Therefore I design and implement a GreedyLeaderBalancer in this PR.

Changes:

1. Implement GreedyLeaderBalancer.
2. Enhance IoTDBClusterLeaderBalancingIT(Add leader balancing about SchemaRegionGroups)
3. Add comparison tests between GreedyLeaderBalancer and MinCostFlowLeaderBalancer
4. Enable leader balancing function, and set the default balancer to MinCostFlowLeaderBalancer

You can see the [RegionGroup-leader balancing algorithm](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcn6xa2p3bvqyF0cwBcit5fkh) doc to get the details of my algorithm designs and test results.

title: [IOTDB-4668] Add Database name length constraint
body:
## Description

Since the name of database will be used as directory name to create directories in file system, the length shall not exceed the max length of file name. The length of database name in mysql shall not exceed 64, which is an immutable config, thus we add this constraint to our database too.

title: [IOTDB-4974] Clarify the boundary of how to be in one group in SessionWindow and StateWindow
body:
## Description
For less than or equal to threshold, we assign them into one group. For greater than threshold, we assign them into a new group.

title: [IOTDB-4970] Enhanced sync safety management
body:
## Description

Before the sync sender can send data, a handshake with the receiver is required. The current handshake policy is to verify the sender's IP address based on the receiver's white list. However, the current sender's ip address is provided by the sender and may be falsified leading to security issues.

 

1. This ISSUE will get the ip address from the thrift connection.
2. The default whitelist is set to 127.0.0.1/32, which rejects all the sender's ip except localhost.
3. Some optimizations have been made to handle cases of handshake failure.

See test case in https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/NsLPdhkC1oa1QCxKOMlcj9RxntK#IM0wdcUQ8oSuMCxaVPXcxjlunlg chapter 2.4~2.5.

title: [IOTDB-4957] Add check for create pipesink and optimize re-connection
body: ## Description https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-4957 1. Add check for create pipesink. For IoTDBPipeSink, it will response exception if ip address is not standard IPv4 address. 2. To avoid busy waiting and large amount of duplicate logs. I optimize logic of re-connection. If sender lost connection to receiver, it will hang up until scheduled heartbeat task successfully reconnect to receiver. Default interval of heartbeat is 30 seconds.
